intro: Reseda stenostachya, commonly known as narrow-stalked reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Reseda stenostachya is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
